tool_description: Instant trademark search,  trademark keyword availabity, search trademarks from USPTO, filter on owner/applicant information, expiration date, retrieve classification, all details
name: USPTO Trademark
title: USPTO Trademark

api_list.name: v1/ownerSearch
api_list.description:
Does a search on **owner name** or **postcode** and returns details about the trademarks found for that owner. Duplicate owner results can be returned by this endpoint, especially when an owner had an address change.

You can use literal 'null' if you don't want to use a param. So you can either search just for a keyword or just for a postcode or together if you want to filter by both.

optional_parameters.name: search_keyword
optional_parameters.description:
This is the search keyword such as 'ferr' that will return results for 'ferrari'.
You can use literal 'null' if you don't want to use this param.

optional_parameters.name: postcode
optional_parameters.description:
This is the postcode such as '95066' that will return results for owners with that postcode in their application. Be aware attorneys might omit postcode from fillings, so those results cannot be returned as they don't have postcode attached as metadata. 

You can use literal 'null' if you don't want to use this param.

api_list.name: /v1/trademarkAvailable
api_list.description: returns if the given keyword is available
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com/v1/trademarkAvailable/amazon"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com/v1/trademarkAvailable/{keyword}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /v1/trademarkSearch
api_list.description: Does a keyword search and returns trademark name, serial number,services code, status, owner, address, filing date and registration date.

required_parameters.name: searchType
required_parameters.description: Default searchType is \"active\", which don't include Dead trademarks, but if you set \"all\" you see also expired trademarks.

api_list.name: /v1/serialSearch
api_list.description: Does a serial number search and returns details about the trademark attributes.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com/v1/serialSearch/75527221"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com/v1/serialSearch/{serial_number}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /v1/databaseStatus
api_list.description:
Returns info about the freshness of the Trademark Search API database.

`last_update_date` holds the date of the newest entry from USPTO filling entries that is synced to the API. 

`latest_trademark` array holds 10 random samples from the most recent confirmed registered trademarks, the `keyword`, the `registration_number` and the `registration_date` . Please note the date could be a few days back as not every day are published new registration of trademarks. They publish daily new partial filings and abandoned trademarks.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com/v1/databaseStatus"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "uspto-trademark.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
